children.text: There are areas of brickwork that still has mortar residue across the faces and edges of the bricks.
The Victorian Building Authority’s Guide to Standards and Tolerances clause 3.07, Masonry Facing states that
‘Masonry faces are defective if they are not cleaned and free of excess mortar’
and clause 3.11, Cleaning, Mortar Smears & Stains states that
‘Stains, mortar smears and damage caused by cleaning are defects if they are visible from a normal viewing positioning’ .
The faces and edges of these bricks will have to be properly and carefully re-cleaned.
